document.discussion_title: Wrecks injure seven on area roads
document.topic_text: Jeff Lehr 3 hrs ago Two teens were injured in an all-terrain vehicle accident at 12:30 p.m. Thursday on Reinmiller Road, 3 miles south of Joplin in Newton County, according to the Missouri State Highway Patrol. The operator of the ATV, Guner Floyd, 13, of Joplin, and his passenger, Ty Sparks, 13, of Vinita, Oklahoma, were taken by ambulance to Mercy Hospital Joplin. Their westbound ATV ran off the road and overturned, the patrol said. • Two people were injured in a two-vehicle accident at 9 a.m. Thursday on Missouri Highway 43, about 20 feet north of the city limits of Southwest City in McDonald County, the patrol said. One of the drivers involved, David D. Kurns, 54, of Bella Vista, Arkansas, and his passenger, Dennis D. Cousins, 50, of Rolla, were taken to Integris Grove Hospital in Grove, Oklahoma. Kurns was driving a Chevrolet Equinox and making a left turn into a private driveway when a Mitsubishi Eclipse tried to pass and struck the Equinox, the patrol said. The patrol's report listed the driver of the Mitsubishi as unknown. Story continues below video • A Mount Vernon woman was injured in a one-vehicle accident at 1:50 p.m. Wednesday on Route V, a half-mile west of Mount Vernon in Lawrence County, the patrol said. Karmen M. Denholm, 44, was taken by ambulance to Cox Medical Center South in Springfield. Denholm was driving a westbound car that ran off the road and overturned, throwing her from the vehicle, the patrol said. • Two Goodman residents were injured in a two-vehicle accident at 4 p.m. Wednesday on Highway 43, 4 miles north of Southwest City, the patrol said. One of the drivers involved, James S. Harris, 74, and his passenger, Syble Harris, 70, were taken by ambulance to Freeman Hospital West in Joplin. Their northbound Dodge Caravan was struck in the rear by a Chevrolet Trailblazer driven by Devon S. Smith, 19, of Grove, Oklahoma, when the Harris vehicle stopped to make a left turn, the patrol said. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
